title: DSA Level 4 — Linked Lists
concept: Singly and doubly linked list creation, insertion, deletion, searching and reversing.

challenges.title: Search Value in Singly Linked List
challenges.description: Given a singly linked list and a value X, determine whether X exists in the list. Print 1 if found, otherwise 0.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers (list values). Third line: X.
challenges.outputDescription: Print 1 if X is present, otherwise 0.

challenges.title: Insert at Beginning
challenges.description: Given a linked list and a value X, insert X at the beginning and print the updated list.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers. Third line: X.
challenges.outputDescription: N+1 integers: list after inserting X at the beginning.

challenges.title: Insert at End
challenges.description: Insert X at the end of the linked list and print the updated list.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers. Third line: X.
challenges.outputDescription: N+1 integers: list after inserting X at the end.

challenges.title: Insert at Position
challenges.description: Insert X at index K (0-based). If K > N, print "Invalid".
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers. Third line: K X.

challenges.title: Delete First Occurrence
challenges.description: Delete the first occurrence of X from the list. If X is not present, print the list unchanged.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers. Third line: X.
challenges.outputDescription: List after deletion, space-separated. If empty, print nothing.

challenges.title: Delete at Position
challenges.description: Delete the node at index K (0-based). If K ≥ N, print "Invalid".
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers. Third line: K.

challenges.title: Reverse Linked List
challenges.description: Reverse a singly linked list and print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Middle of Linked List
challenges.description: Find the middle element of a singly linked list. If even length, print the second middle element.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Detect Cycle (Floyd)
challenges.description: Given a linked list, detect whether a cycle exists. Input gives N, N node values, and pos where tail connects (-1 means no cycle). Print "YES" if there is a cycle, otherwise "NO".
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers (values). Third line: pos (0-based index where tail connects, or -1).

challenges.title: Merge Two Sorted Linked Lists
challenges.description: Given two sorted linked lists, merge them into one sorted list and print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers (sorted). Third line: M. Fourth line: M integers (sorted).
